q: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
h:
“You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!” —
John Lennon

q: Life's too mysterious to take too serious.
h:
“Life's too mysterious to take too serious.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Cultivate the merry heart, develop the happiness habit, and life will become a continual feast.
h:
“Cultivate the merry heart, develop the happiness habit, and life will become a continual feast.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: In order for you to be the BEST you can be for others, first you must be BEST for yourself.
h:
“In order for you to be the BEST you can be for others, first you must be BEST for yourself.” —
Jeffrey Gitomer

q: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.
h:
“It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Dream big and dare to fail.
h:
“Dream big and dare to fail.” —
Norman Vaughan

q: Passion creates, addiction consumes.
h:
“Passion creates, addiction consumes.” —
Gabor Mate

q: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
h:
“Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
h:
“You cannot find peace by avoiding life.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
h:
“A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
h:
“Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.” —
George Eliot

q: Real learning comes about when the competitive spirit has ceased.
h:
“Real learning comes about when the competitive spirit has ceased.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: He who hesitates is a damned fool.
h:
“He who hesitates is a damned fool.” —
Mae West

q: The way out is in.
h:
“The way out is in.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: You are what you believe in. You become that which you believe you can become.
h:
“You are what you believe in. You become that which you believe you can become.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: The wise speak only of what they know.
h:
“The wise speak only of what they know.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
h:
“Let each man exercise the art he knows.” —
Aristophanes

q: If you want to achieve anything in this world, you have to get used to the idea that not everyone will like you.
h:
“If you want to achieve anything in this world, you have to get used to the idea that not everyone will like you.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage.
h:
“Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: When you want something in life, you just gotta reach out and grab it.
h:
“When you want something in life, you just gotta reach out and grab it.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: A good stance and posture reflect a proper state of mind.
h:
“A good stance and posture reflect a proper state of mind.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: You make your own luck if you stay at it long enough.
h:
“You make your own luck if you stay at it long enough.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The more one judges, the less one loves.
h:
“The more one judges, the less one loves.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
h:
“Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.
h:
“Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.” —
Colin Powell

q: The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.
h:
“The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: An intelligence test sometimes shows a man how smart he would have been not to have taken it.
h:
“An intelligence test sometimes shows a man how smart he would have been not to have taken it.” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.
h:
“Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Adults are just children who earn money.
h:
“Adults are just children who earn money.” —
Kenneth Branagh

q: All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree.
h:
“All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree. ” —
Albert Einstein

q: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
h:
“Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.
h:
“Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.
h:
“If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Life is a gift. Never forget to enjoy and bask in every moment you are in.
h:
“Life is a gift. Never forget to enjoy and bask in every moment you are in.” —
Celestine Chua

q: The things I carry are my thoughts. That's it. They are the only weight. My thoughts determine whether I am free and light or burdened.
h:
“The things I carry are my thoughts. That's it. They are the only weight. My thoughts determine whether I am free and light or burdened.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Fashion fades, only style remains the same.
h:
“Fashion fades, only style remains the same.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Success in any endeavor depends on the degree to which it is an expression of your true self.
h:
“Success in any endeavor depends on the degree to which it is an expression of your true self. ” —
Ralph Marston

q: I think it's very important to have a feedback loop, where you're constantly thinking about what you've done and how you could be doing it better.
h:
“I think it's very important to have a feedback loop, where you're constantly thinking about what you've done and how you could be doing it better.” —
Elon Musk

q: People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.
h:
“People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.” —
Gary Keller

q: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
h:
“We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.
h:
“Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.” —
Sigmund Freud
